article_title: U.S. Economy’s Promises, and Perils, of 2015
article_text:
Economists often disagree, but they share a broad consensus on one point: The U.S. economy is among the world’s best off as 2015 begins. Where there’s less agreement is whether this is as good as it gets.

Pessimists cite mounting risks from overseas, especially deflation threats in many countries. Optimists point to momentum from a healing labor market, one that very likely will see 2014 go down as the best year for job growth in 15 years when the Labor Department releases its December employment report on Friday. The...

og.description: The Outlook: The U.S. economy is among the world’s best off, but economists differ on how strong 2015 will be, with risks from overseas counterbalancing a healing labor market.
og.title: U.S. Economy’s Promises, and Perils, of 2015

article_metadata.author: Nick Timiraos
article_metadata.article.origheadline: Can U.S. Economy Keep Powering Ahead?

article_summary:
Economists often disagree, but they share a broad consensus on one point: The U.S. economy is among the world’s best off as 2015 begins.
Pessimists cite mounting risks from overseas, especially deflation threats in many countries.
Where there’s less agreement is whether this is as good as it gets.
Optimists point to momentum from a healing labor market, one that very likely will see 2014 go down as the best year for job growth in 15 years when the Labor Department releases its December employment report on Friday.
